question: 5 (c)
statement_html:
Consider the region below the graph \(\displaystyle y = 1-x^{3}\) (and above the x axis) between \(x=0\) and \(x=1\).

c) Suppose the density of the solid from part (b) is \(\displaystyle p(y) = ky\). Find its mass.
statement_latex:
Consider the region below the graph $\displaystyle y = 1-x^{3}$ (and
above the \emph{x} axis) between $x=0$ and $x=1$.

c) Suppose the density of the solid from
{part
(b)} is $\displaystyle p(y) = ky$. Find its mass.
statement_raw:
Consider the region below the graph <math> \displaystyle y = 1-x^{3} </math> (and above the ''x'' axis) between <math>x=0 </math> and <math>x=1 </math>.

c) Suppose the density of the solid from [[Science:Math Exam Resources/Courses/MATH103/April 2006/Question 05 (b)|part (b)]] is <math>\displaystyle  p(y) = ky </math>. Find its mass.
